snippet: The second round at the Women’s British Open was suspended, and scores were voided as winds up to 60 m.p.h. created unplayable conditions at Royal Liverpool Golf Club.
abstract: Second round at the Women’s British Open is suspended and scores are voided, as strong winds up to 60 mph create unplayable conditions at Royal Liverpool Golf Club in Hoylake, England.
lead_paragraph: The second round at the Women’s British Open was suspended, and scores were voided as winds up to 60 m.p.h. created unplayable conditions at Royal Liverpool Golf Club.

headline.seo: Winds as High as 60 M.P.H. Halt Play at Women’s British Open
headline.main: With High Winds, Play Is Halted and Day’s Scores Are Voided
headline.print_headline: With High Winds, Play Is Halted and Day’s Scores Are Voided
